text:
November 6, 2015. On tap at All In Beer Fest. 
Black with a minimal brown head. Aroma is malty and roasted with sweet notes of caramel, milk chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, dark chocolate, toasted coconut and spicy peppery rye notes and oak. Taste is intense, sweet, malty and light warming. Finish is sweet malty with caramel, toffee, vanilla, bitter dark chocolate, some coffee notes, spicy peppery notes, some wood notes and warming bourbon. Full bodied, oily, soft carbonation. 
Very good!

Crowler... This beer rocks! Pours murky and black with no head. Smells great  a chocolate bomb; featuring a decadent mélange of fudge, chocolate chips and chocolate crème flanked by lesser notes of leather, vanilla and coconut. Full-bodied and silky with minimal carbonation. The flavor offers a collage of chocolate crème and brownie brittle with nuances of vanilla and caramel. Lightly roasty and faintly sweet in the fatty, velvety finish. Kudos to landhoney for supplying this world class bottle of beer!

crowler shared by a friend during our tasting. still a lot of carbonation after these months. poured an oily black colour with a big dark beige head on top. nose of sweet dark roasted malts, rye spices heat, clean sweet bourbon barrel notes, charred, dark fruits, dark bitter chocolate, chocolate fudge and molasses. taste is thick and viscious. clear spiced rye upfront. perfect amount of bourbon, sweet vanilla oak, very thick mouthfeel. one of the better cycle bourbon stouts without any adjuncts. very glad i had the chance to try this one. lovely

Crowler thanks to Brian. Pours a very dark brown with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong roast, cocoa, rye, bourbon, wood. Thick mouth, chewy, roast, bourbon, vanilla, rye, chocolate, very nice.

Much thanks to Kraddel! Crowler sampled. Yay my first crowler. Beer is in an amazing condition considering that there are a few months on this crowler. I think that it would a smidgeon better if it were in a bottle but it still tastes really amazing. Pours black, head is instantly gone. Nose is massive thick syrup, warming, vanilla, mocha, thick warming bourbon syrup, sugar, Taste is gorgeous thick syrup, sweet sugar, warming, chocolate syrup, massively thick & sludgy in the best way, chocolate sugar, finish carries lingering vanilla & sweet vanilla bourbon. Amazingly thick & syrupy. When Cycle is good, they are really good. Chugged the bottom of the crowler, not recommended, it is warming when you sip but when you chug it really starts tasting massively alcoholic.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2016 crawler @ gollem

Small to no head. Sharp smell, grainy bourbon, chocolate. Epic and full bodied. Malty, vanilla, oaky. Chocolate. Lots of bourbon! Epic beer for sure!

Crowley shared thanks to Kraddel. Black with a small beige head. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon, oak barrel, caramel, booze, chocolate, cookies and rye. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Crowler courtesy of and shared with Kraddel. 
Very thin tan head. Clear black pour. Rum aroma. Lovely

Pours black, small grey head. Smell is Sharp, grainy bourbon. Taste is heavy bourbon , black malts , vanilla, some oak. Very very Nice bourbon character. Very full. Amazing beer ! Perfect bourbon notes.

How: Draught.
Where: All In Beer Fest 2015.
Appearance: Black colour with a tan head.
Aroma: Bourbon, rye, chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, rye.
Crowler. BA Rye Stout, aka Four Roses DOS. Black pour with tan head. Rye, bourbon, sweet chocolate and dark aromas. Bourbon, coffee, rye, chocolate Flavors.
Crowler - pours black tan head - nose and taste of rye, whiskey, roast chocolate, vanilla and baked brownie - med body

Tap at Cycle. Aroma is just insanely good. Huge cookie dough, vanilla, sugar cookies, bourbon, chocolate cake, burnt caramel and marshmallow. Tastes incredible too. Perfect mellow sweetness to counter the bourbon. Burnt marshmallow, cookie dough, chocolate cake, molasses, oak, vanilla, and light rye spiciness. Seriously tastes like bourbon soaked smores. My second perfect score Ive given. This may be my absolute perfect beer.

Black pour, dark khaki head. Nose is fudge, vanilla, cherry cordial, booze. Taste is chocolate, vanilla, coconut, oak, rye, cherry cordial on the back end, some warmth. Full sticky mouthfeel. So flavorful, one of the better Cycle stouts Ive had in a while.

Draught @ All In Beer Fest 2011. Labeled as Barrel Aged Rye Stout (4 Roses Bourbon). Pours viscous oily pitch black with a creamy mocha head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is intense and malty with roasted malts, caramel, sweet dark rye bread, vanilla fudge, charred wood, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, black pepper corns, toasted coconut, moist soil, tar and hints of bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty. Mouthfeel is fat, oily, viscous, round, roasted astringent, tiny boozy and full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, caramel, dark rye bread, vanilla fudge, charred wood, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, moist soil, black pepper corns and bourbon alcohol. Amazing sweet imperial stout with added complexity both from the peppery rye malts and the bourbon barrel treatments. Best in show at the fest and one of the best imperial stouts Ive tried. Nice!!

Crowler to glass. Pours a thick deep black color with a medium brown head. Aroma is big and bourbony, coffee, roasted malts. Massively thick and chewy body with a wonderful bourbon, coffee, chocolate flavor. Thanks BJ!

Sample at All In Beer Fest. Pitch black with no head. Aroma and taste of molasses, vanilla, milk chocolate and light roasted notes. Slightly boozy, warming finish where the bourbon shows. Excellent bourbon BA stout.

Oh my godness. What a tasty and smooth is. Not much wrong to say about this one.[Sinful black oily liquid with a small beige layer on top. Smooth soft carbonation and a full body. Alcohol? Where did they hide that? Dangerously stuff. Powerful flavor and good intensity in the aroma. Lots of oak, mild bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, espresso and molasses.[On tap at All In Brewing Festival in Gothenburg, Sweden - 2015]

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 Crowler.  Dark brown/black pour with a chocolate head. Enticing barrel and oak bouquet. Wow, sweet with chocolate, caramel, vanilla, and oak highlights. Mellow bourbon backbeats. A stunner. Complex with a fantastic body and mouthfeel.

From tap at All in beerfest. Pitch-black with a medium brown head. Aroma of bourbon!, roasted malt, caramel, dark chocolate, coffee and dried fruits. The taste almost match the wonderful aroma. Full-bodied. Medium bitterness. and low to medium carbonation.

32 oz. crowler. Inky black body. Very viscous looking. Thin khaki collar. Bourbon aroma. Dark chocolate. Fudge and licorice, as many Cycle stouts exhibits. Taste is sharp bourbon. Rich, acidic, and bitter chocolate. Really intense. Sharp and tingly alcohol. Heavy and boozy. Medium carbonation. This is really heavy and intense, but its pretty good.
Crowler. Black with deep brown head. Nose is bourbon, molasses, a hint of coffee. Very viscous. Bitter chocolate, bourbon with a slight bite of rye. Very very nice.
